definition: to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: The paper studies on the effect of impressafining on absorbability of wood chips.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了擠壓疏解作用對木片吸收性的影響。

sentences.english: Can you explain the meaning of these foreign words?
sentences.chinese: 你能疏解這些外文詞的意思嗎？

sentences.english: There is an anonymous quote that states, “A smile confuses an approaching frown.”
sentences.chinese: 有一個無名的引用，“微笑疏解欲皺的眉。”

sentences.english: She tried to temper her angst by thinking positively.
sentences.chinese: 她是這用正面思考來疏解自己焦慮的情緒。

definition: to dredge/to open up a path for/to remove obstructions/to clear the way/to enlighten/persuasion
to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
low-paid workers in industries that offer jobs for the unskilled/derogatory-sounding abbr. for 低端產業從業人口|低端产业从业人口
to unblock/to dredge/to clear the way/to get things flowing/to facilitate/to mediate/to lobby/to explicate (a text)
to understand clearly/to be sensible or reasonable/understanding
